text: The Nature Conservancy was a British government agency established by Royal Charter in 1949. It established a small network of research stations, which became sites for significant basic and applied ecological research.Bocking S. 1997 Ecologists and Environmental Politics: A History of Contemporary Ecology. New Haven: Yale University Press. The Nature Conservancy was superseded by the Nature Conservancy Council in 1973. ==References== Category:Environmental organisations based in the United Kingdom Category:Conservation in the United Kingdom Category:Defunct public bodies of the United Kingdom Category:1949 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1973 disestablishments in the United Kingdom Category:Government agencies established in 1949 Category:Government agencies disestablished in 1973
title: Nature Conservancy (UK)
